intro: Comesperma calymega, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to red. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands.
